alert.note: Alert for Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 2:56PM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms have been forming and reforming over the west slope of the Bighorn Mountains in extreme southeast Washakie County east of Big Trails Thursday afternoon. These showers and storms have produced very heavy rain, which is likely leading to minor flooding of small creeks and streams. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, extreme southeast Washakie. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes and draws along the west slope of the Bighorn Mountains. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Rapid water rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen Thursday afternoon - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Otter Creek drainage, Crooked Creek drainage, Vee Road, Dry Farm Road, and other low-lying areas around Big Trails.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, creeks, and rivers can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
